name: The Edinburgh Cup 2026
shortDescription: The Edinburgh International Cup welcomes boys’ and girls’ teams to Scotland’s capital, offering 4v4 to 11v11 competition, development, excitement, and an unforgettable festival atmosphere at top-class venues.
programOverview: The Edinburgh International Cup is one of the UK’s leading youth football tournaments, held annually in the vibrant and historic city of Edinburgh. Taking place 7–9 August 2026, the competition brings together boys’ and girls’ teams aged 7 to 16, offering both competitive and festival-style formats to suit all levels. Matches are played across professional-quality venues, with game formats ranging from 4v4 to 11v11, ensuring every team can compete in a structure suited to their development stage and playing style. The tournament promotes teamwork, inclusivity, and enjoyment, creating a memorable football celebration for players, coaches, and families.
programHighlights: UK's largest youth football tournament.
Competitive and festival entry options.
Age groups 7–16, with multiple match formats (4v4–11v11).
Hosted at high-quality Edinburgh football venues.
A vibrant, inclusive atmosphere for teams and families.
whatsIncluded: Tournament entry fees for the Edinburgh Cup 2026.
Accommodation for the duration of the stay (typically twin/triple sharing) at nearby hotels.
Use of grass and turf pitches and local training facilities.
Minimum guaranteed number of competitive matches in 4's, 5's, 7's, 9's and 11's.
Pre-tournament training sessions.
Welcome event including team orientation and briefing.
Awards ceremony and trophies for finalists and champions.
Sightseeing options and cultural excursions in the Edinburgh area.
Private group transfers between airport, accommodation, and venues.
Dedicated tour management and on-site support.
Optional extended stay activities including additional training, video analysis, and workshop opportunities.

itinerary.title: Travel
itinerary.description: Flight. Overnight flights to Edinburgh.

itinerary.title: Arrival + Training Block 1
itinerary.description: Arrive Edinburgh, meet Tour Director at airport, airport transfer, hotel check-in. Lunch and orientation meeting. Afternoon training session. Evening dinner.

itinerary.title: Sightseeing + Training Block 2
itinerary.description: Welcome meeting for tournament plus registration. Afternoon training session. Team dinner.

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 1
itinerary.description: Morning group stage matches at premier Edinburgh football venues. Lunch break with team bonding and player rest. Afternoon matches continue and festival activities. Evening debrief and dinner.

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 2
itinerary.description: Final matches including semi-finals and finals for competitive categories, festival games for others, and awards ceremonies for all age groups.

itinerary.title: Recovery Session + Edinburgh Sightseeing
itinerary.description: Light recovery session, Edinburgh Castle guided tour or Harry Potter Tour, evening Underground Ghost Tour, team awards dinner.

itinerary.title: Travel
itinerary.description: Departure from Edinburgh with airport transfers.

developmentFocus.fixtures: With Axis Football Tours, teams can compete in top-level international tournaments, facing opponents from around the world. All logistics are handled — including fixtures, pitch hire, referees, and travel — ensuring a seamless, professional experience. Tournaments provide a thrilling environment that builds confidence, resilience, teamwork, and unforgettable memories on the global stage.
developmentFocus.training: Teams travelling with Axis Football to participate in tournaments will have the opportunity to include training sessions either delivered by the team's own coaching staff or you can be trained by coaches from local professional club academies. All players will be given a Player Development Plan (PDP) highlighting an improvement plan regardless of the level they are currently at.
developmentFocus.classroom: At Axis Football Tours, tournament programmes can include dedicated classroom sessions to support team preparation. Through match analysis, tactical planning, opponent scouting, role clarity, and team-identity workshops, players build confidence, understanding, and cohesion before stepping onto the pitch.
developmentFocus.teamBonding: During tournaments delivered as part of your Axis Football Tour, we can provide meaningful team bonding experiences to strengthen unity and performance. Through shared activities, group challenges, guided reflection, and positive social time, players build trust, communication, and resilience.

accommodationMealsSafety.accommodation: With Axis Football Tours, every detail of your stay is designed to match the prestige of your football experience. We’ve partnered with a handpicked collection of exceptional hotels across the globe — each offering first-class comfort, style, and amenities perfectly suited to your team’s needs. Our accommodations are carefully selected for their prime locations — whether steps away from elite training facilities or set within resort-style complexes offering outstanding sports and leisure options. Every property meets our rigorous standards for quality, safety, and service, ensuring a seamless and inspiring experience from check-in to check-out. We believe your surroundings should elevate your performance. That’s why we exclusively feature premium 3 and 4-star hotels, chosen to provide superior comfort and a touch of luxury throughout your tour. Typically based on 2–4 persons sharing, your full-board package includes delicious, nutritious meals — with lunches served at the hotel or training complex, and evening dining experiences either at your accommodation or a quality local restaurant.
accommodationMealsSafety.meals: We have half and full board options for travelling groups depending on your needs. We recommend the full board for most of our groups knowing that you have everything taken care of on site.
accommodationMealsSafety.playerSafety: We only work with accredited partners ensuring you have a safe and stress-free tour. Risk assessments are completed for all our tours and support is provided 24/7 by our team and on the ground with your very own Tour Director.

name: The T.I Manchester Cup
shortDescription: T.I Manchester Cup 2026 is a Premier international youth football tournament in Manchester with global teams, pro pitches, licensed referees, accommodation, transfers, and awards.
ageBand: Boys - U7 to U19, Girls - U12, U14, U16, U18
programOverview: The T.I Manchester Cup 2026 is a premier international youth football tournament held in Manchester, UK, on April 4-5. It welcomes youth teams worldwide to compete on high-quality pitches with qualified referees, ensuring a professional and fair tournament experience. Participants receive full support, including accommodation with breakfast, airport and local transfers, and tournament entry. The event features multiple competition levels, awards for finalists, and opportunities for cultural exchange in Manchester. Customizable tour packages and extras like friendly matches and training camps are available to create a tailored, unforgettable football journey for teams and their families.
programHighlights: UK's largest youth football tournament.
Competitive and festival entry options.
Age groups 7–16, with multiple match formats (4v4–11v11).
Hosted at high-quality Edinburgh football venues.
A vibrant, inclusive atmosphere for teams and families.
whatsIncluded: Entry into the T.I Manchester Cup tournament
Full board accommodation at hotel
Qualified licensed match officials for all games
Airport transfers in Manchester to and from accommodation
Coach transfers between accommodation and tournament and excursions
On-site support from experienced staff throughout the tournament
Presentation of awards for finalists
Additional nights, friendly matches, and training sessions available
Match tickets (Subject to availability)

itinerary.title: Travel
itinerary.description: Flight Overnight flights to Manchester.

itinerary.title: Arrival + Training Block 1
itinerary.description: Arrive Manchester, meet Tour Director at airport, airport transfer, hotel check-in., Lunch and orientation meeting. Afternoon training session. Evening dinner.

itinerary.title: Sightseeing + Training Block 2
itinerary.description: Welcome meeting for tournament plus registration. Morning training session. Visit to National Football Museum. Old Trafford Stadium Tour. Team dinner.

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 1
itinerary.description: Morning group stage matches at premier Edinburgh football venues. Lunch break with team bonding and player rest. Afternoon matches continue and festival activities. Evening debrief and dinner.

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 2
itinerary.description: Continued group stage or knockout matches. Afternoon training session with Manchester City coaches. Group dinner

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 3
itinerary.description: Semi-finals and finals matches at tournament venue. Award ceremony and celebrations. Team dinner and reflection on the tournament

itinerary.title: Travel
itinerary.description: Return to US

name: The Newcastle Summer Cup
shortDescription: The Newcastle International Summer Cup is a youth football tournament, bringing together teams worldwide for exciting matches and memorable experiences in Newcastle.
programOverview: The Newcastle International Summer Cup is a youth football tournament hosted in Newcastle, celebrated for memorable matches and experiences from previous years. It welcomes teams from various from all over the world providing young players opportunities to compete, connect, and create lasting memories in a vibrant summer atmosphere.
programHighlights: UK's largest youth football tournament.
Competitive and festival entry options.
Age groups 7–16, with multiple match formats (4v4–11v11).
Hosted at high-quality Edinburgh football venues.
A vibrant, inclusive atmosphere for teams and families.
whatsIncluded: Minimum of 5 matches per team.
3 or 4-star hotel accommodation options (minimum 2 nights).
Daily breakfast at accommodation.
Opening ceremony and award presentations.
Free team photo (digital copy).
Free VeoCam recorded match (subject to availability).
Free gift for each player.
Plenty of trophies and medals.

itinerary.description: Depart from US, overnight flight to Newcastle

itinerary.title: Sightseeing + Training Block 2
itinerary.description: Welcome meeting for tournament plus registration. Morning training session. St James Park Stadium Tour. Explore Newcastle. Team dinner.

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 1
itinerary.description: Opening Ceremony. Group stage matches begin. Social activities in the evening. Team dinner at hotel

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 2
itinerary.description: Continued group stage or knockout matches. Afternoon training session with Manchester City coaches. Group dinner

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 3
itinerary.description: Continued group stage or knockout matches. Afternoon coaching session with Newcastle United coaches. Group dinner

name: The Big One 2026
shortDescription: The Big One 2026 is the UK’s premier two-day 11v11 youth football tournament at Warwick University, featuring top grassroots teams, professional officiating, and guaranteed games.
season: 4th and 5th July 2026 ( Boys U11 to U17).18th and 19th July 2026 ( Girls U11 to U18).
programOverview: The Big One 11v11 Youth Football Tournament 2026 is the UK’s premier youth football event, hosted at the University of Warwick Sports Village. Open to U12–U18 grassroots boys’ teams, it features elite A-grade pitches, professional officiating, and a fair play format with knockout stages. Teams enjoy 90–120 minutes of guaranteed play, AI filming for highlights, and awards including trophies and MVP recognition. With accommodation packages for a full weekend experience, this prestigious tournament offers a top showcase for young talent.
programHighlights: UK's largest youth football tournament.
Competitive and festival entry options.
Age groups 7–16, with multiple match formats (4v4–11v11).
Hosted at high-quality Edinburgh football venues.
A vibrant, inclusive atmosphere for teams and families.
whatsIncluded: Elite A-grade grass pitches at University of Warwick Sports Village
Professional officiating with 3+ officials per match
Guaranteed 90–120 minutes of game time per team
Group stage and knockout rounds (Champions Cup, Shield, Plate) tailored to ability
Trophies, medals, and MVP awards for recognition
AI camera filming for player highlights and social media exposure
Opportunity to showcase talent to a wider audience

itinerary.title: Travel
itinerary.description: Fly to London Heathrow or Birmingham Airport

itinerary.title: Arrival + Training Block 1
itinerary.description: Arrive in UK and meet Tour Director. Transfer from airport to accommodation, check-in & lunch. Afternoon training session. Group welcome dinner to acclimate and review tournament plans

itinerary.title: Sightseeing + Training Block 2
itinerary.description: Welcome meeting for tournament plus registration. Morning training session. St James Park Stadium Tour. Explore Newcastle. Team dinner.

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 1
itinerary.description: Breakfast at accommodation. Transfer to University of Warwick Sports Village. Participate in Day 1 matches of The Big One Tournament. Evening team debrief and recovery session. Dinner and relaxation

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 2
itinerary.description: Breakfast at accommodation. Transfer to University of Warwick Sports Village. Participate in knockout rounds (Champions Cup, Shield, or Plate). Awards ceremony and closing celebrations. Team dinner & reflection on tournament performance

itinerary.title: Recovery Session + Edinburgh Sightseeing
itinerary.description: Light recovery session. Lunch. London Guided Tour & Emirates Stadium Tour. Team awards dinner.

itinerary.title: Travel
itinerary.description: Return Flight from London/ Birmingham

Teams enjoy 90–120 minutes of guaranteed play, AI filming for highlights, and awards including trophies and MVP recognition. name: Salou Youth Cup
shortDescription: The Salou Youth Cup Verano 2026 offers competitive football and leisure from July 1–5, for boys and girls born 2007-2019, at top-quality pitches with hotel accommodation.
programOverview: The Salou Youth Cup Verano 2026 takes place July 1–5 in Salou, Spain. Open to boys’ and girls’ teams born between 2007 and 2019, matches are played at Complex Futbol Salou on top-quality natural and artificial pitches. Teams enjoy a full football program with group games, playoffs, and finals, plus free time for excursions. Accommodation is provided in nearby hotels with a refundable damage deposit. Combining competitive football with Mediterranean leisure, the Salou Youth Cup offers an unforgettable summer tournament experience.
programHighlights: Teams from all over the world
Top facilities at Complex Futbol Salou
Open to Boys’ and girls’ teams born 2007–2019
Group stages, playoffs, and finals
Explore this beautiful resort
whatsIncluded: Participation in a 5-day international youth football tournament with a minimum of 4 matches per team.
Categories for boys and girls from various age groups (born 2007 to 2019) with separate female divisions.
Use of high-quality football fields with natural and artificial grass close to hotels.
Accommodation at 3/4-star hotels with full board and a refundable damage deposit.
Transportation package covering airport/station transfers and daily transfers between hotel and playing fields.
Tournament kit including registration, welcome kit, and player hydration (water).
Federated referees officiating matches.
Player injury insurance coverage.
Medals for all players and trophies for the top three teams in each category.
Commemorative photos and tournament magazines for all teams.
Opening ceremony and final awards presentation.
Training with FC Barcelona coaches
Tour of Spotify Camp Nou
Team training session

itinerary.title: Travel
itinerary.description: Flight. Overnight flights to Barcelona

itinerary.title: Arrival + Training Block 1
itinerary.description: Arrive Barcelona, meet Tour Director at airport, airport transfer, hotel check-in. Lunch and orientation meeting. Afternoon training session. Welcome meeting for tournament plus registration. Distribution of registration kits. Evening dinner.

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 1
itinerary.description: Breakfast at hotel. Morning group stage matches begin at Complex Futbol Salou. Lunch break with team bonding & player rest. Afternoon group stage matches continue. Evening team dinner and optional team review session.

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 2
itinerary.description: Breakfast at hotel. Morning round of group stage matches. Lunch at hotel. Afternoon visit to PortAventura World theme park. Team dinner and rest.

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 3
itinerary.description: Breakfast at hotel. Morning playoff matches begin. Lunch break. Afternoon continuation of playoff matches. Teams prepare for finals or consolation rounds. Evening team dinner and rest.

itinerary.title: Tournament Day 4
itinerary.description: Breakfast at hotel. Morning final matches and consolation matches held. Afternoon award ceremony with trophies and medals presentation. Closing banquet/dinner to celebrate tournament conclusion. Evening free for packing and relaxation.

itinerary.title: Sightseeing
itinerary.description: Hotel Breakfast, Transfer from Salou to Barcelona, Guided tour of Barcelona, Dinner in Barcelona

itinerary.title: Training
itinerary.description: Breakfast at hotel. Training with FC Barcelona coaches. Stadium Tour of Camp Nou. Team dinner at hotel

itinerary.title: Travel
itinerary.description: Flight to US

developmentFocus.fixtures: With Axis Football Tours, teams can compete in top-level international tournaments, facing opponents from around the world. All logistics are handled — including fixtures, pitch hire, referees, and travel — ensuring a seamless, professional experience. Tournaments provide a thrilling environment that builds confidence, resilience, teamwork, and unforgettable memories on the global stage.
developmentFocus.training: Teams travelling with Axis Football to participate in tournaments will have the opportunity to include training sessions either delivered by the team's own coaching staff or you can be trained by coaches from local professional club academies. All players will be given a Player Development Plan (PDP) highlighting an improvement plan regardless of the level they are currently at.
developmentFocus.classroom: At Axis Football Tours, tournament programmes can include dedicated classroom sessions to support team preparation. Through match analysis, tactical planning, opponent scouting, role clarity, and team-identity workshops, players build confidence, understanding, and cohesion before stepping onto the pitch. These sessions ensure teams arrive ready to compete with purpose and unity.
developmentFocus.teamBonding: During Tournaments delivered as part of your Axis Football Tour, we can provide meaningful team bonding experiences to strengthen unity and performance. Through shared activities, group challenges, guided reflection, and positive social time, players build trust, communication, and resilience. These moments deepen team identity and connection, helping squads compete with confidence, togetherness, and purpose on and off the pitch.

accommodationMealsSafety.accommodation: With Axis Football Tours, every detail of your stay is designed to match the prestige of your football experience. We’ve partnered with a handpicked collection of exceptional hotels across the globe — each offering first-class comfort, style, and amenities perfectly suited to your team’s needs. Our accommodations are carefully selected for their prime locations — whether steps away from elite training facilities or set within resort-style complexes offering outstanding sports and leisure options. Every property meets our rigorous standards for quality, safety, and service, ensuring a seamless and inspiring experience from check-in to check-out. We believe your surroundings should elevate your performance. That’s why we exclusively feature premium 3 and 4-star hotels, chosen to provide superior comfort and a touch of luxury throughout your tour. Typically based on 2–4 persons sharing, your full-board package includes delicious, nutritious meals — with lunches served at the hotel or training complex, and evening dining experiences either at your accommodation or a quality local restaurant. (Comparable alternatives may occasionally be used if your featured hotel is unavailable.)
accommodationMealsSafety.meals: We have half and full board options for travelling groups depending on your needs. We recommend the full board for most of our groups knowing that you have everything taken care of on site.
accommodationMealsSafety.playerSafety: We only work with accredited partners ensuring you have a safe and stress-free tour. Risk assessments are completed for all our tours and support is provided 24/7 by our team and on the ground with your very own Tour Director.
